title: Consumer automobile loans dataset — aloans
text: brief description

title: Consumer automobile loans dataset — aloans
text: data frame 58,118 rows 7 columns: risk_cat Credit score category Z Time--event Y Truncation time C Censor indicator (1 = censored, 0 = censored) D Default indicator (1 = default, 0 = default) bond Categorical variable specifying different bonds.

title: Consumer automobile loans dataset — aloans
text: DATASETS SOURCE (get paper)

title: Calculate Default Time Points — calc_tp
text: helper function generates default sequence evaluation points based study's overall time range (PUT REFERENCE ). particular, calculates \(\Delta\) \(m\) based left-truncation time--event variables outputs sequence ranging \(\Delta + 1\) ??.

title: Calculate Default Time Points — calc_tp
text: time_to_event vector event censoring times. trunc_time vector left-truncation times.

title: Calculate Default Time Points — calc_tp
text: numeric vector default time points evaluate hazard .

title: Hazard rate — estimate_hazard
text: Estimate non-parametric hazard rate truncated censored data

title: Hazard rate — estimate_hazard
code: estimate_hazard(   time_to_event,   trunc_time = NULL,   event_indicator = NULL,   censoring = NULL,   event_type = NULL,   support_lifetime_rv = NULL,   return_cdf = TRUE,   carry_hazard = FALSE,   ci_level = 0.95 )

title: Hazard rate — estimate_hazard
text: time_to_event numeric vector representing observed time event. trunc_time numeric vector representing observed left-truncated time. event_indicator event indicator vector (1=default, 0=censored). Defaults NULL (censoring), equivalent vector ones. censoring indicator censoring (1=censored, 0=). Defaults vector 0s NULL. observation treated event status=1 censoring=0. event_type vector "events identifies" (experimental) support_lifetime_rv vector time points evaluate hazard.  NULL (default), calculated sequence Delta + 1 omega (, max(time_to_event)). return_cdf boolean indicator whether return estimated CDF associated hazard rate . Default TRUE carry_hazard boolean indicator whether 0 hazard estimates replaced last non-zero estimate. Defaults FALSE ci_level number 0 1 indicating level confidence intervals.

title: Hazard rate — estimate_hazard
text: data.frame hazard estimate standard errors asymptotic confidence intervals.

title: Hazard rate — estimate_hazard
text: Point estimate asymptotic confidence intervals calculated based  (can also include brief notation/definitions )

title: \(\hat{f}(x)\) — f_hat
text: t time point hazard estimates sought. time_to_event numeric vector representing observed time event. event event indicator censoring indicator censoring (1=censored, 0=). Defaults vector 0s NULL. observation treated event status=1 censoring=0.

text: x data.frame required columns 'alife' object. Defaults empty data.frame.

title: Create an alife Object — new_alife
text: object class alife.

title: Create an alife Object — new_alife
code: # Create a minimal data frame with the required columns df <- data.frame(time_to_event = 1:2, fh = c(.2, .01), uh = c(.8, .20),                  hazard = c(0.1, 0.125), se_log_hazard = c(0.1, 0.1),                  lower_ci = c(0.08, 0.1), upper_ci = c(0.12, 0.15))  # Construct the alife object my_alife_obj <- new_alife(df) class(my_alife_obj) #> [1] "alife"      "data.frame"

title: Plot Method for an 'alife' Object — plot.alife
text: x object class alife. Typically output estimate_hazard function. col_ci color confidence interval polygon. col_line color hazard rate line. ... Additional arguments passed base plot function (e.g., main, xlab, ylab, ylim).

title: abslife 0.0.92
text: Fixed competing risks approach.

title: abslife 0.0.91
text: event_type parameter estimate_hazard function now deals competing risks. single_t_hazard internal function created. meant make code easier debug expliting big estimate_hazard function self-contained chunks. ci_level now parameter estimate_hazard function. First draft estimate_hazard function. far, competing risks implemented. calc_tp helper calculates \(\Delta\) \(m\) based left-truncation time--event variables outputs sequence ranging \(\Delta + 1\) \(\Delta + m\). Create class alife enable plot method estimate_hazard function output. Function carry hazard estimates forward “zero hazard” observed.

title: abslife 0.0.9
text: dataset aloans included far.
